item.title: Sariah add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "A 'no' does not hide anything, but a 'yes' very easily becomes a deception." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first draft of anything is shit." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The most important things are the hardest to say. They are the things you get ashamed of, because words diminish them -- words shrink things that seemed limitless when they were in your head to no more than living size when they're brought out. But it's more than that, isn't it? The most important things lie too close to wherever your secret heart is buried, like landmarks to a treasure your enemies would love to steal away. And you may make revelations that cost you dearly only to have people look at you in a funny way, not understanding what you've said at all, or why you thought it was so important that you almost cried while you were saying it. That's the worst, I think. When the secret stays locked within not for want of a tellar but for want of an understanding ear." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Bad writing is more than a matter of shit syntax and faulty observation; bad writing usually arises from a stubborn refusal to tell stories about what people actually do― to face the fact, let us say, that murderers sometimes help old ladies cross the street." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "But sorry is the Kool-Aid of human emotions. [...] True sorrow is as rare as true love." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sariah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "People don't get better, they just get smarter. When you get smarter you don't stop pulling the wings off flies, you just think of better reasons for doing it." -- Stephen King
